page.title: 08The Bournville Carillon
page.content: There are only 13 carillon around the British Isles and one of them is in the Birmingham suburb of Bournville. It is situated on top of{Bournville Junior School}and is made up of{48 bells}.The heaviest known as the tenor weighs just over 64 cwt and its note is A sharp. The bells were all cast in{Loughborough at Taylors bellfoundry.}They are played using a keyboard of batons and foot pedals which are connected by wires to the clappers of the bells. When a baton is firmly struck the clapper is pulled to the side of the bell and the note is sounded. The instrument is played with a series of baton movements by the carilloneur. There are{recitals}every Friday of school terms and every Sunday afternoon in the summer months. An audience often gathers on{Bournville Village Green.}The most popular recital is at Christmas when carols are played.
